A Drug Conviction In Missouri Will No Longer Keep Someone From Food Stamps For Life Low - income people in Missouri with drug felony convictions on their records have been banned from receiving food stamps under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program ( SNAP ) since the late 1990s .

RelatedSentence: Missouri is one of just nine states that still imposes a lifetime food stamps ban on anyone convicted of a drug felony .

The bill Missouri lawmakers passed last week would retain a one - year waiting period following a drug felon 's release from custody , and a third drug felony conviction would still trigger a lifetime ban .
